Boot.definition: additional money or property received to make up the difference in an exchange of business or investment property that is of like kind but unequal in value NOTE
Boot.origin: [obsolete or dialect boot compensation, from Old English b≈çt advantage, compensation]

1.1: additional money or property received to make up the difference in an exchange of business or investment property that is of like kind but unequal in value
1.note: Under Internal Revenue Code section 1031, no tax liability results from an exchange solely of like-kind property used in a business or trade or held for investment. If the exchange includes boot, however, under section 1245 the boot will be treated as ordinary income.
